name: places/ChIJ-2OC1b9ZwokRL9jXr279oQI
adrFormatAddress: 48 8th Ave, New York, NY 10014-5104, USA

originalText.text: Beyond rude. You don’t have to beg in New York City to find a good tailor who is nice. Really rude here so I took my things and left. Went to a much better tailor who has a good and respectful attitude. I had the exact same experience as David Howerton who posted here too. The man working here flatly refused to work on my coat. He gave a high price ($160 for an alteration), and estimated 2 weeks. When I brought the coat 2 days later to have it done, his answer was it would take “six, maybe ten weeks” .. and after showing me all the clothes he has backed up to fix, he said rudely “come back next year.” If you ever need a solid and professional tailor who is fast, and nice as well, go to Ely’s Custom Tailor at 317 E. 14th St.

originalText.text: Van Gogh Cleaners and Tailors serves the neighborhood with quality and excellence.  For over 15 years, I have been going to them for all of my drying cleaning and tailoring.  There is a fitting room in the back to support a brief collaboration on the desired look.  Recently, I went to have a unique dress tailored for a special occasion.  It was a vintage dress that required detailed attention.  After the superb craftsmanship, the dress fit perfectly.   Thank you for your talented work!

It was a vintage dress that required detailed attention.  After the superb craftsmanship, the dress fit perfectly.   Thank you for your talented work!

originalText.text: I walked into this location today to have my trenchcoat tailored and asked the gentleman sitting at the sewing machine if he would be able to work on the garment. Without even looking at the garment he said NO and instructed that I purchase a smaller garment . I told him that it didn't make sense to purchase one if I had one already and assured him that money was not an issue and he refused again. I hate to pull race card however he didn't even inspect the garment he just said no. I would have happily paid any amount for the work but he obviously does not need my business. Do not support this establishment

originalText.text:
The guy that performs the tailoring does a very bad job and overcharges.
1) I went in to get two pairs of pants hemmed.  At first he was going to hem them with out measuring them on.  I had to insist that he measure them with me wearing them. Then he insisted that he only needed to take a measurement of one of the pants. He needed two extra weeks to complete the job.  One of the pairs was two inches two short. It took another 3 weeks to get these back.
2) On the phone they quoted one price and when he saw me walk in, he charged $3 more per pair of pants.

I consider the tailor both unethical and a horrible tailor.

originalText.text: I needed to hem a bright pink gown. They used white thread and completely noticeable stitching, which obviously ruined the dress. This was not a rush job, so they had more than enough time to get the right colored thread
